properties.name: Belmar, CO
properties.description: Posted by Cameron lakewood coloradoPrevious home of Villa Italia Mall - at one time known for being the Largest Mall West of the Mississippi. Now home to new mixed-use urban renewal project known as Belmar. Stores/Restaurants/public open spaces downstairs and apartments/condos upstairs. Also townhomes built by green builders McStain out of Boulder, CO. Also features a block of designer/studio spaces and future additions include artist live/work space. Although it will soon price itself out of the average Joe\'s budget it\'s still a great new area in the middle of VERY blah/suburban Lakewood.

properties.name: Big Sur
properties.description: Posted by Cameron  Some of the most incredible coast line on the entire Pacific Ocean. Also the place I will retire (hopefully early...) to.

properties.name: Camas Produce
properties.description: Posted by Cameron Locally owned and operated produce market in Camas, WA near Lacamas Lake.

properties.name: Cascade Head
properties.description: Posted by Cameron  Top of the Nature Conservatory trail in Cascade Head, OR. From here you can look down at the Salmon River entering the Pacific Ocean. From here you can also see (but not touch or walk on) a specific breed of grass that grows only on this spot and nowhere else in the world. Easy

properties.name: Cerro San Cristobal
properties.description: Posted by Cameronsantiago chileGiant hill in the middle of Santiago Chile. When I was there I rode the funicular up to the top and the big statue of the Virgin Mary and then hiked down. The next day I hiked up and rode a cable car down! A great way to see the city, the Andes and the amazing amount of pollution there... Also on the hill is a public swimming pool, zoo, and botanical garden. Very near is the neighborhood (bario) of Bella Vista. A great area to shop cheap in. You MUST eat at the restaurant Galindo if there. Order the Lomo alo Pobre and the most expensive glass of red wine on the menu. With tip you\'ll pay about 0 to have the best steak and red wine of your life.

properties.name: Chicago, Illinois
properties.description: Posted by CameronchicagoFor no particular reason except "Because" I think Chicago would be a place I would enjoy living. I\'ve been in the Chicago O\'Hare Airport like 25 times and every time I think to myself, "I\'ve gotta come back here and spend some time in Chicago" instead of simply passing through.

properties.name: Christchurch, NZ
properties.description: Posted by Cameron Our first stop in our 2 week campervan trip through NZ was here. How in the world did it take me 28 years of living to make it here. It\'s not a matter of if I\'ll go back, it\'s when, and how long I\'ll be there....

properties.name: Cinque Terra
properties.description: Posted by Cameron  monterossoFive small pedestian only villages built on the cliffs of the Italian riviera and all connected by incredible hiking trails. Reminicsent of Big Sur in central CA but with centuries old vinyards and houses on the hillsides. Originally built on cliffs and close together to aide in escape and warning for the Turkish pirates! Arrrggg!

properties.name: Dog Park
properties.description: Posted by Cameron  Unofficial "official" off-leash park in East Vancouver. Currently very big area for dogs and their people. Official master plan for site will drastically reduce off-leash area (see website for more info) but will add many features for entire community. A gem in the suburban wasteland that is East Vancouver (Vantucky).

properties.name: East Berlin, Germany
properties.description: Posted by CameronberlinAfter spending some time in Berlin in 2004 I instantly starting hatching schemes in my head of how I could feasably relocate from the US. Without being able to put it into words I felt home there and like I could become lost (in a good way) living there. Something about Berlin is different to me and I can\'t describe it. I didn\'t expect to become so attached but I still think of Berlin as a place I could call Home.

properties.name: Former Location of Pizza Plus
properties.description: Posted by Cameron Here\'s where Pizza Plus used to be! Jason\'s younger brother (and another one of my cousins) Eric worked here and used to come home with Jo-Jos, pizza and amazingly hilarious stories. I remember being at the Wilson house when he would come home from work and hearing stories through laughter about the "one fingered man" who would threaten to beat himself up if he didn\'t get free pizza and how they would wipe the pepperoni around the toilet bowl for asshole customers.

properties.name: Listening to NPR & Heard A.T.C. Piece on Platial.
properties.description: Posted by CameronPlatial On All Things Considered...Was pleasantly surprised to hear a piece on Platial on All Things Considered while at the gas station.

properties.name: My house!
properties.description: Posted by Cameron4734 nw park court camas wa The location of my current home. I swear it\'s not what it looks like - I\'m planting myself in suburbia to instigate my future take-over of the world! Revenge will be mine! Hummers, apathy and lattes will NOT be the future!

properties.name: Patagonia & The Falkland Islands
properties.description: Posted by Cameron chiloe islandThough I\'ve been to Chile & Argentina, I\'ve not been to the southern parts of either country. Patagonia, near the 45th parallel, has a near identical climate to the Pacific NW I love so much. The difference though is that all the seasons are directly backward from the northern hemisphere and there is considerably less civilization there. The Falkland Islands appeal to me for entirely different reasons. I just like the idea of a little Brittish, English-speaking society so totally isolated on an island group off the coast of Argentina. Apparently the place is important enough that England and Argentina actually got into a war about who owned it. I also love the fact that residents refer to anywhere on the island outside of Stanley (the biggest town there) "Camp."

properties.name: Prague, Czech Republic
properties.description: Posted by CameronPragueBefore I had ever been to Prague I decided it would be a let down. I had heard several tales of planned 2 days in Prague that turned into 10 and the like. With everyone telling me how great it was I decided it couldn\'t be. When I finally did make it to Prague I proved myself wrong. It was what I had always heard and more. Prague is almost cliche for Americans going to Europe but hey, don\'t cliches get that way for a reason? Like Berlin, I felt at home in Prague. Directly after graduating college my then girlfriend and I discussed taking advantage of the fact that we had no commitments to anything and nothing was tying us down by moving to Prague. That never came to fruition - in retrospect I can see that she never had any real intention of moving there. As far as I can tell she just liked the idea of it and telling people she was considering it.

properties.name: Preikestolen
properties.description: Posted by Cameron  25 square meter flat rock several hundred feet above the water outside Stavanger, Norway in the Norwegian Fjords. The most amazing place I\'ve ever been.

properties.name: Quebec City, Quebec
properties.description: Posted by Cameronquebec cityI think the closest I could come to living in France while still in North America.

properties.name: Slept on a Boat in Stockholm
properties.description: Posted by CameronstockholmWent to Stockholm on a whim while we were in Europe last. I had gone through briefly 10 years previous on the way to Jorpeland, Norway via Oslo and Stavanger. We had no idea where we were going to stay that night so we wandered through old downtown and down the river to a now non-seaworthy boat that has been converted into a very cool hotel/hostel. After checking in we went back into downtown and ate Swedish Fish in a public square where there was a weird "Man on the Street" Diet Coke promotion. There were two Uber-hip looking Swedes at a table with like, thousands of cans of Coke. One of them was yelling "Free Diet Coke!" in Swedish while the other was opening cans at hyper speed and handing them out. Back at the Boat-el I discovered that the showers were just like, wide open with the rest of the bathroom. Sinks on one side of the room and showers on the other with no curtains or anything. No big deal except that if a shower is on everything gets wet. It\'s almost like there\'s just sinks in the shower room or somehting. So I take a shower at about 11:00pm and there\'s this Ultrahighfashion Italian dude in there brushing his teeth getting ready for a night on the town trying not to get sprayed from the shower!

properties.name: The Tree
properties.description: Posted by CameronportlandWhile sitting at "The Tree" you can look down to the resovoir and further to downtown Portland. It\'s a great vantage point on the whole city. Whenever I sit myself down here I feel both isolated from culture and exposed to nature - a toxic combination! The best part is that the roots of the tree grow just perfectly so you can sit between them and rest your back on the trunk and feel like you\'re kicking back in a La-z-boy! Go there on a warm clear night, sit, and absorb the stillness that is what Portland life is all about.

properties.name: Top Burger
properties.description: Posted by Cameron camas washingtonTop Burger is at the top of my list for best burger and fries (or tots!) in the greater Portland area. Cheap and good housed in a charmingly run-down business. Typically fully staffed by Camas High School students this place has a lot of good character and rad milkshakes too!

properties.name: Vancouver, BC
properties.description: Posted by Cameronvancouver canadaLike Portland, Vancouver is an extrememly "livable" city. On my one short trip there I was overwhelmed with the kindness and friendliness of the people there and the beauty of the city itself. When crossing the border into Canada on my only trip to BC thus far the crossing guard asked where we were going to. I said, "Vancouver." He asked where we were coming from. I said, "Vancouver!" as in Vancouver, WA. I thought it was hysterical - the crossing guard not so much. Vancouver seems at the same time so much like the U.S. and so much NOT like the U.S. It\'s different enough, yet familiar enough for me to want to call it Home.

properties.name: Walking Man Brewery
properties.description: Posted by Cameron   Rad micro-brewery with amazingly good beer and equally good food located in a beautiful part of the Columbia River Gorge.

properties.name: Where Boring and Dullsville Meet
properties.description: Posted by Cameronogden utThe first time I really got a sense of how truly EMPTY most of the western United States is was when I moved to Colorado. Driving from Where I-84 and I-80 meet through eastern Utah and through southwestern Wyoming in the UHaul truck with non-working windshield squirters in the sleet and mud was a truly eye opening experience. Out here you can drive 100 miles and not see ANYTHING except nothing.

properties.name: Where The Heck Is That Pizza Delivery Guy?  He Should Have Been Back an Hour Ago!
properties.description: Posted by Cameron The best backwards filmed-forwards spoken short film I\'ve ever seen!!! Filmed on location at the Wilson house.

properties.name: ipd
properties.description: Posted by Cameron11744 NE Ainsworth Circle portland oregon 97220One of the sources fueling the past and continual hotbed of Volvo car activity in the Pacific Northwest. Also provides performance parts and upgrades for Subaru cars.
